intro: Astragalus arabicus, commonly known as the Arabian milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the Middle East and North Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its root system is deep, allowing it to access water from deeper underground. Astragalus arabicus is also known for its medicinal properties, traditionally used in herbal remedies for its purported health benefits.
